name: Blessings
description:
Blessings provides financial assistance to young, single, pregnant women for daycare and scholastic accountability so they can graduate from high school. They are connected with a Christian mentor and participate in life skills and parenting classes and are required to attend a Christ-centered church weekly.

We hope you will jump in and participate with this ministry to learn more about it and the people they serve. Just as we encourage new members to know and trust our church before they give financially, please do not feel any obligation to give to this ministry until you learn more and feel the Holy Spirit leading you to do so.

options.name: Annual Walk/Bike Event
options.details:
Sat., May 13 from 10 a.m. – noon.
Walk or bike to support Blessings at their annual fundraiser at Stow-Munroe Falls High School. For more information, or to register for this event visit blessingsspc.com/events.

options.name: Drywall/Flooring
options.details: An opportunity stills exists for a community group to renovate a room in the basement of a grandparent’s house for a Blessings single mom and her child. The room is now ready for drywall and flooring. For details on this project, email Barbara. Funds are available for materials.

name: Broken Chains
description:
Broken Chains Ministry is a faith-based, non-profit headquartered in the Summit County Jail in Akron. The mission is to engage former offenders for the purpose of reintegration back into the community, thereby lowering recidivism rates in Akron and increasing public safety. Introducing these former offenders to Jesus Christ is the primary and most important thing this ministry works to accomplish.

We hope you will jump in and participate with this ministry to learn more about it and the people they serve. Just as we encourage new members to know and trust our church before they give financially, please do not feel any obligation to give to this ministry until you learn more and feel the Holy Spirit leading you to do so.

options.name: Visit Urbean Café
options.details:
Enjoy a meal at Urbean Café and support Broken Chains and their clients at the same time.
Mon. – Fri. from 7 a.m. – 7 p.m.
Sat. from 9 a.m. – 3 p.m.
631 S Broadway St., Metro Transit Center, Akron, OH 44311
Urbean Cafe Video

options.name: Tour Summit County Jail
options.details: Take a tour of the Summit Count Jail with Dennis Shawhan, executive director of Broken Chains. The tour can accommodate a group of up to 12 people any weekday from 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. We need at least two weeks notice to gain clearance with the jail. Email Dennis to sign up or for more info.

name: Faithful Servants
description:
Faithful Servants is a Christian-based health care organization committed to providing urgent care to the uninsured with an income below 200% of the Federal Poverty Level in the greater Akron area. Services are provided at no cost to the patient by professional, licensed physicians and clinicians who volunteer their time and talents to serve those in need.

We hope you will jump in and participate with this ministry to learn more about it and the people they serve. Just as we encourage new members to know and trust our church before they give financially, please do not feel any obligation to give to this ministry until you learn more and feel the Holy Spirit leading you to do so.

options.name: Volunteers’ Meal
options.details: Prepare and deliver a ready-to-eat meal to our eight to ten volunteer doctors and nurses before they being their shift, many of whom come straight from work to serve. To reserve an evening, email Kathi.

options.name: Clean the Clinic
options.details: Clean the medical clinic in Tallmadge the fourth Saturday of each month and tour the facility. For more details, email Kathi.

name: First Glance
description:
First Glance is a student center in the Kenmore community of Akron that is open most evenings of the week with the mission of connecting students to Christ and the church through real, loving and non-threating avenues.

We hope you will jump in and participate with this ministry to learn more about it and the people they serve. Just as we encourage new members to know and trust our church before they give financially, please do not feel any obligation to give to this ministry until you learn more and feel the Holy Spirit leading you to do so.

options.name: Visit the Skate Park
options.details:
Mon., Tue., Thu. & Fri. 4-10 p.m.
943 Kenmore Blvd., Akron, OH 44314
For those looking for a more adventurous opportunity, visit and use the indoor skate park at the First Glance Ministry Center.
$5 fee per person. Free on Tuesdays

options.name: Volunteer with Children
options.details: Help out on a Tues. from 4-7 p.m. in First Glance’s Tiny Glancers’ classroom (children of teen/young moms.) Email Karen Freeman for more information and to let her know you are coming.

options.name: Ministry Building Maintenance
options.details: Are you handy? Opportunities are available for a variety of skill levels and dates and times. Email Bill.

options.name: Make a Meal
options.details: Make a Frozen Meal and drop it off (for Monday Student Leaders meeting, Tuesday Man Up, Ladies, or Moms meetings). Contact Jessica for more information and to sign up.

name: Haven of Rest
description: Haven of Rest provides Christ-centered programs and services that respond to the physical, spiritual and emotional needs of homeless and poor men, women and children in the Akron area.

options.name: Ministry Tours
options.details:
Nov. 9 from 2-7 p.m.
175 E Market St, Akron, OH 44308
Contact Rose, Community Relations Coordinator, to schedule a tour 330.535.1563.

options.name: Clothes/Food
options.details:
Mon. – Fri. from 8 a.m. – 6 p.m.
Sat. from 9 a.m. – 5 p.m.
207 East Market Street, Akron, OH 44308
Collect items needed to bring to Haven of Rest. Help feed the homeless and tour Haven of Rest while you are there. Current needs are: shampoo, deodorant, toothbrushes, toothpaste, canned fruit and vegetables, coffee and beverage mixes, men's tennis shoes and pants (especially waist sizes 28” to 34”), ladies undergarments, socks for infants and toddlers, twin bed sheets and bath towels. To arrange for a tour when you drop off your donation, email Rose.

options.name: Work in the Kitchen
options.details: Email Jan Pluck, volunteer coordinator at Haven of Rest, to sign up for a date to work in the kitchen and help feed the homeless of Akron.

name: Legacies of Success
description: Legacies of Success (LOS) exists to revitalize the North Hill community by transforming the neighborhood one house at a time. LOS efforts are invested in improving the lives of the current residents and helping them to benefit from the improvements in the neighborhood. Changing the lives of the current residents and introducing them to Christ is the top priority.

options.name: Home Rehab
options.details: Once the next home is purchased, opportunities to participate in the rehabilitation and restoration of the home will be posted.

name: Mobility Worldwide
description:
Mobility Worldwide is a faith-based, volunteer-driven non-profit that manufactures and distributes mobility carts so that recipients may “in the name of Jesus Christ, arise and walk.” (Acts 3:6).

We hope you will jump in and participate with this ministry to learn more about it and the people they serve. Just as we encourage new members to know and trust our church before they give financially, please do not feel any obligation to give to this ministry until you learn more and feel the Holy Spirit leading you to do so.

options.name: Production Facility Tour Drop-In
options.details:
Tue. – Thu. from 9:30 a.m. – 12 p.m.
1445 Commerce Dr., Stow, OH 44224
Take a tour of this Stow-based ministry partner
For more information, email Lee Petno

options.name: Open House
options.details: Sun., May 21 from 12-4 p.m.

name: Pregnancy Solutions & Services
description:
Pregnancy Solutions & Servies (PSS) is a pregnancy medical center that seeks to empower and educate people in pregnancy-related decisions. Through the use of free pregnancy tests, ultrasounds and options counseling, they hold out truth with the hope to save babies from abortion and lead men and women to a relationship with Jesus. They have a center in Portage Lakes and a medical mobile unit that travels throughout the community.

We hope you will jump in and participate with this ministry to learn more about it and the people they serve. Just as we encourage new members to know and trust our church before they give financially, please do not feel any obligation to give to this ministry until you learn more and feel the Holy Spirit leading you to do so.

options.name: Prayer Walk
options.details:
Mon. – Fri. from 9 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.
3136 Manchester Rd, Akron, OH 44319
Prayer walk through the ministry center with a custom card that guides you through the ministry rooms and gives specific prayer needs. This is a great opportunity to see the center and have a big impact on their fight to save lives.

options.name: Donate an Item
options.details: Provide needed items for Emma’s closet: diapers of any size, baby clothing and toys for a child under age of two.

options.name: Annual Walk/Bike Event
options.details: This event will be held at Christ Community Chapel this summer. Details available in May.

options.name: Makeover Emma's Closet
options.details: Emma’s Closet, PSS’s donation boutique, is in need of a makeover. There are three project opportunities:  painting, new flooring and new fixtures. CCC has funds to purchase materials. Group can choose to do any portion of the project.

name: Rahab Ministries
description:
Rahab is a non-profit Christian ministry of volunteers devoted to rescuing and restoring women who are trafficked into prostitution in Northeast Ohio.

We hope you will jump in and participate with this ministry to learn more about it and the people they serve. Just as we encourage new members to know and trust our church before they give financially, please do not feel any obligation to give to this ministry until you learn more and feel the Holy Spirit leading you to do so.

options.name: Rahab Gift Bags
options.details: Put together gift bags for Rahab’s strip club outreach. Each bag could have a baked good, something encouraging (scripture) and a small personal item (nail polish, journal). For more information, email Barbara.

options.name: Prepare/Serve Lunch
options.details:
82 S. Arlington St. Akron, OH
Prepare and serve lunch for registrants going to the Personal Prayer Mapping Conference Apr. 22 at Middlebury Chapel. CCC has grant money to cover the cost of food for a community group to take on this project. For details, email Jacque.

options.name: Administrative Support
options.details:
Mon. – Fri. from 9 a.m. – 5 p.m.
Help with administrative tasks in the Rahab office for a two-hour time block. One week’s notice is requested. Email Beth to schedule.

options.name: Open House
options.details:
Jun. 7 from 6 – 8 p.m.
Attend an open house to tour Rahab’s drop-in center for minors in Akron
Jun. 12 from 6 – 8 p.m.
Attend an open house at Rahab’s walk-in center in Akron
Call Rahab to RSVP for either open house or ask questions 330.810.3326.

name: South Street Ministries
description:
South Street Ministries was founded and modeled after the philosophies of the Christian Community Development Association (CCDA). The backbone of the CCDA's ministry philosophy is the three R's: relocation, racial reconciliation and redistribution. Work includes jail, youth, women's ministries, after-school programs, bike shops, an urban garden and other community outreaches.

We hope you will jump in and participate with this ministry to learn more about it and the people they serve. Just as we encourage new members to know and trust our church before they give financially, please do not feel any obligation to give to this ministry until you learn more and feel the Holy Spirit leading you to do so.

options.name: Visit Front Porch Café
options.details:
Mon. – Fri. from 7 a.m. – 3 p.m.
798 Grant Street, Akron, OH 44311

options.name: Make a Meal
options.details: Provide a meal for 8-10 doctors and nurses volunteering at the Faithful Servants medical clinic site every Wed. at the Front Porch. For more information, email Joe Tucker.

options.name: Annual Rails to Trails Bike Event
options.details: Details available in May.

name: True North Ministry
description: Every year, True North Ministry reaches more than 2,200 imprisoned youth with Christ-centered programming via 130 volunteer missionaries. The mission of this ministry, “to liberate imprisoned youth,” permeates all aspects of the organization and reflects the youth they serve.

options.name: Visit the Farm
options.details:
Mon., Wed., Thu. & Fri. from 10 a.m. – 4 p.m.
Visit six young men working on the farm and bring them lunch. Email Dave or call 330.896.2700 to plan your visit.

options.name: Lead a Bible Study
options.details: We need some new volunteers for the True North bible studies at the Dan Street Juvenile Detention Center in Akron. We go there once a month on the fourth Sunday. The bible studies are from 9-10 a.m., leaving plenty of time to get to the third service on those days. For more information, email Duncan Othen.

options.name: Dusty Donkey Festival
options.details: Visit the farm and get to know True North's ministry opportunities one Saturday this fall. More details to come.

name: Truly Reaching You
description:
Truly Reaching You Ministries (TRY) is a relationship-based reentry organization that reaches out to men and women who have served their sentence and are returning to their communities. Through relationships, mentorships, training and education, TRY provides a healthy support system for those who have made the commitment to surrender their old lifestyle. Pointing the men and women to Christ is the number one priority for this ministry.

We hope you will jump in and participate with this ministry to learn more about it and the people they serve. Just as we encourage new members to know and trust our church before they give financially, please do not feel any obligation to give to this ministry until you learn more and feel the Holy Spirit leading you to do so.

options.name: Attend Open House
options.details:
Apr. 20 from 2-7 p.m
685 Brown St Akron, OH 44311
Attend an open house to celebrate the opening of the first house sold to a former participant, Kelly Bolyard and her 9-year-old son. Local and state organizations (including TRY) will be recognized for their participation in rehabbing and furnishing the house and in guiding Kelly's recovery.

options.name: Ministry Center Tour
options.details:
Mon., Wed., Thu. & Fri. from 9:30 a.m. – 3:30 pm.
587 Baird St, Akron, OH 44311
To schedule your tour or ask a question, email Sherrie.

options.name: Renovation Projects
options.details: Three renovation projects (paint and repurpose) are available for groups at TRY’s Ministry Center. CCC has funds to help purchase materials needed. Email Hallie for details.

name: Urban Vision
description: Urban Vision reaches the North Akron Community by demonstrating the redemptive love of Jesus Christ through Christ-centered programs focusing on the needs of the people in their community by restoring lives one child and family at a time.

options.name: Attend a Class
options.details:
Life Skills Class: Mon. from 3:30-4 p.m.
Jr. Achievement Class: Tue. from 3:30-4 p.m.

Email Regina to let her know to you plan to attend at least 24 hours before these two classes. You will receive a quick tour of the ministry center 15 – 20 minutes before class.

options.name: English as a Foreign Language (EFL) Class
options.details:
Tue. & Thu. from 6-8 p.m.
Classes can accommodate five visitors where refugees learn English. Email Bena to reserve a spot.

options.name: Easter Candy
options.details: Donate individually wrapped Easter candy for their annual Easter Egg Hunt outreach and take a tour of the ministry. Contact Regina for more information.

options.name: Donate for After-School Programs
options.details: Donate powdered juice mixes, paper products (cups, plates, bowls, napkins) or juice boxes for Urban Vision’s after-school kids programs. When you drop off the donations, you can tour the ministry. For more information, email Evie.

options.name: Attend 25-Year Anniversary Celebration
options.details:
Mon., Sep. 25 at Christ Community Chapel – Hudson Campus.
Contact Evie for more information or to register.

name: Restoration Chapel
description: Restoration Chapel is a ministry of Christ Community Chapel located at the Cuyahoga Hills Youth Detention Center. Weekly service includes worship, a message and time to interact with the young men who attend. 25-75 young men from the facility that houses 160 young men from the age of 12-18 attend weekly. We also hold bible studies, skills classes and participate in the weekly orientation intake process.

options.name: Attend a Service
options.details:
Wed. from 6:30-8 p.m.
4321 Green Rd, Highland Hills, OH 44122
Men and women 18 and older are able to enter the facility as a guest. Email Richard White at least 24 hours in advance so he can obtain a gate pass.

name: Nursing Home Ministry
description: We view the nursing homes listed below as venues of Christ Community Chapel. Volunteers lead a full worship service at each location to take authentic worship to those who are unable to get out and attend at one of our campuses. Your company is greatly appreciated by those attending and those who are leading the weekly services!

options.name: Portage Trail Village
options.details:
1st & 3rd Monday from 10:15-11:15 a.m.
45 Cathedral Lane
Cuyahoga Falls, OH 44223

options.name: Gables of Hudson
options.details:
2nd Friday from 10:30-11:30 a.m.
5400 Darrow Rd.
Hudson, OH 44236

options.name: Heritage of Hudson
options.details:
3rd Friday from 10:30-11:30 a.m.
1212 Barlow Rd.
Hudson, OH 44236

options.name: Gardens of Western Reserve
options.details:
3rd Sunday from 2:30-3:30 p.m.
9975 Greentree Parkway
Streetsboro, OH 44241

options.name: Anna Maria of Aurora
options.details:
889 N. Aurora Road
Aurora, OH 44202
Email Mary for info about Bible studies, services and opportunities to serve.

name: Wild Card Option
description: As a wild card option, you can choose a second opportunity at a ministry and count it as one of your eight activities. For example, you can visit the ministry center at PSS and then participate in the bike-a-thon.  Or you could visit the Front Porch Café and then return with your community group to do a project at the Front Porch at South Street as a wild card activity.

options.name: Act II Impact
options.details: Join Pastor Jim Colledge for Act II’s next impact meeting at Mobility Worldwide in Stow where you will hear volunteers from this ministry talk about the impact they have been able to have worldwide by building mobility carts. Email Kathy to RSVP.
